document_content.title: Referral to Internal Medicine for Further Evaluation

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Carter is being referred for evaluation of persistent fatigue, intermittent joint pains, and unexplained weight loss over the past three months.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports progressive fatigue and generalized weakness. She has noticed joint discomfort, particularly in her wrists and knees, without significant swelling. There is a documented unintentional weight loss of 5 kg over three months. No fevers, night sweats, or rashes reported.

sections.heading: Relevant Past Medical History
sections.content: No known chronic illnesses. No previous hospitalizations or surgeries. No allergies.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Occasional acetaminophen for joint discomfort. No regular medications.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vitals stable. Mild pallor observed. No lymphadenopathy or organomegaly. Mild tenderness over wrists and knees but no erythema or swelling.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent CBC shows mild normocytic anemia (Hb: 10.8 g/dL). ESR mildly elevated. Basic metabolic panel and thyroid function tests within normal limits.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistent symptoms and initial laboratory findings, further evaluation is requested to rule out systemic causes such as connective tissue disease or early inflammatory arthritis.
